column4: That looks like it's the best you're gonna get... :p I would try saving the document in .doc
Can you explain again what the issue is?
I am creating some bid sheets for an auction.  As long as the files were small (3 or 4 pages) there were no problem.  They are now 8 to 12 pages and worked fine until I close them.
now when I open one the memory takes of and tops at about 2GB and the program is non responsive.  Sometimes it may try to act normal until I save the file and the same thing happens.
Can you try opening those documents in AbiWord or Google Docs to see if you can save them in a different format?
I will try.  I don't have AbiWord installed but I can.
It might just be a problem with ooffice, but it might also be a problem with the documents themselves.
google docs uploads them and shows them fine minus so layout and formating.
it is also throwing away the header and footer
Have you tried opening it in AbiWord?
just installed AbiWord and trying now.
AbiWord opens it about as well as GD.  It did keep the footer though.
I did.  Well, I downloaded from GD in .doc.  I would save it that way from OO if I could open it.
this is the first time that OO (linux / open source) has really let me down.  I have wasted hours on this and am so tempted to just do it at work with word.  Never thought I would think that.
I'm sorry you're having problems... I don't like to use the .odf format. I usually don't mess around with it.
found the problem if you are interested.

I was using the draw toolbar to put in some horizontal dividing lines.  They were causing the crash.  I edited the content.xml and deleted all the <Draw:Line>...</Draw:Line> code sections and things seem to be happy.
Nice! How did you figure that out?

I had tried to delete them within OO.  I noticed they were not staying put to their anchor point.  Sense the crash got worse even on file that were good the more I opened them I did some snooping.  I searched the file I had deleted them from for Draw and noticed that there were still some in there even though I had deleted all the visible ones.  Just seemed odd to I removed the remaining ones.
Hmm. I would stick to .doc from now on...
I will at least be avoiding the draw toolbar!
Haha. Good idea!
